content: meeting in 4 minutes ! https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/Devtools-team-meetings--AfVgFCjuY7SfRxRYEoHqrQ_ZAg-CGijjZIVoybEvU4Co5Hms
was just about to ask if we were still meeting lol
Hey everyone! welcome to our meeting!
Looks like we mostly have team updates on the agenda, anyone want to go firsT?
I just finished writing up notes for rustfmt, happy to go first

rustfmt

3 unstabilized options Iâ€™d like to deprecate, want to run it past this team before asking for feedback/objections from broader community (report_todo, report_fixme, license_template_path). Somewhat buggy features that IMO are completely unrelated to formatting/reformatting of code. The first two involve searching for TODO or FIXME text in comments, the latter is used to enforce files start with a license

Minor bug fixes/refactoring

Continued activity/contributions from a couple folks who seem to be sticking around
i've clearly still not figured out Zulip message formatting
heh
i think removing unstable options is fine
you should chat with @Joshua Nelson a bit, he's been going through unstable rustdoc features and doing a structured triage
worth doing
from clippy's side: no major updates
i think we have low attendance today (happens for the rust project near the end of the year)
i guess we can wrap up early?
I had something I wanted to ask about.
I'd like to see people's thoughts about how to deal with getting blocked by other teams, and how to approach it.
go for it!
I tend to get in situations where what I want to do depends on some other group approving it. And it can take months or years to get forward progress.

Eric Huss said:

I'd like to see people's thoughts about how to deal with getting blocked by other teams, and how to approach it.

blocked as in a sequencing thing where you need something from someone else or
yea. Just needing some other team to approve a PR for example.
I tend to have moderate success having conversations with people of that group; sometimes they invite you to their meeting etc
I completely understand, as I probably have a hundred PRs waiting for my review.
So I don't really know the answer.
yeah it's hard
i think it's okay to ask for a timeline, and explain why it is a priority for you
are there any higher level cross-team forums where cross-team dependencies like this can be shared?
yea, that sounds like a good idea. I was thinking of trying to get like a video or voice chat to try to see if they have questions or whatever.
not really, the answer is basically "bug the leader/members of that team"
the core team did want better product-oriented thinking in rust and being able to track this better would be a part of that
it would be nice if there were basically a team of folks tracking progress like that
but right now, just talk to em 1:1
right, someone looking at the forest as opposed to everyone focused on their individual trees
I think another thing is that it can be difficult to evaluate the importance.
was just thinking the same thing. managing competing priorities/divergent perspectives on priorities is always a challenge
Like most of what I want to do isn't super important, but when it gets delayed for months, I tend to forget the context and it makes it harder.
ok, thanks! I'll see if I can try to get conversations going to at least see if there is anything that can be done.
Are we planning to meet next month? be heavily into the holiday season for many
let's cancel
i'm out of town anyway
sgtm
happy 2022 to everyone then? :laughter_tears:

Manish Goregaokar said:

you should chat with Joshua Nelson a bit, he's been going through unstable rustdoc features and doing a structured triage

"doing a structured triage" is strong wording for "glanced at about half of the features"
but yes I'm hoping to clean this up in rustdoc too lol

@Joshua Nelson for unstable rustdoc features that you and the team think should be dropped, is there any kind of process/communication practice you all are following or are you just going ahead with the relevant code changes?
my sense has always been that unstable opts are subject to be removed at any time, but also trying to balance that with giving folks an opportunity to persuade me otherwise
@Caleb Cartwright I haven't discussed it with the rest of the team yet but my idea was to ping the original author and say "hey we want to get rid of this, please open an RFC if you want to keep it"
and give maybe a week or two before actually deleting it
my internet is really problematic this evening... I'll write the rustdoc update in the doc once my page has loaded...
